verses.verse: Wisdom<WH2454> hath builded<WH1129> her house<WH1004>, she hath hewn out<WH2672> her seven<WH7651> pillars<WH5982>:
She hath killed<WH2873> her beasts<WH2874>; she hath mingled<WH4537> her wine<WH3196>; she hath also furnished<WH6186> her table<WH7979>. her beasts: Heb. her killing
She hath sent forth<WH7971> her maidens<WH5291>: she crieth<WH7121> upon<WH1610> the highest places<WH4791> of the city<WH7176>,
Whoso is simple<WH6612>, let him turn in<WH5493> hither: as for him that wanteth<WH2638> understanding<WH3820>, she saith<WH559> to him,
Come<WH3212>, eat<WH3898> of my bread<WH3899>, and drink<WH8354> of the wine<WH3196> which I have mingled<WH4537>.
Forsake<WH5800> the foolish<WH6612>, and live<WH2421>; and go<WH833> in the way<WH1870> of understanding<WH998>.
He that reproveth<WH3256> a scorner<WH3887> getteth<WH3947> to himself shame<WH7036>: and he that rebuketh<WH3198> a wicked<WH7563> man getteth himself a blot<WH3971>.
Reprove<WH3198> not a scorner<WH3887>, lest he hate<WH8130> thee: rebuke<WH3198> a wise man<WH2450>, and he will love<WH157> thee.
Give<WH5414> instruction to a wise<WH2450> man, and he will be yet wiser<WH2449>: teach<WH3045> a just<WH6662> man, and he will increase<WH3254> in learning<WH3948>.
The fear<WH3374> of the LORD<WH3068> is the beginning<WH8462> of wisdom<WH2451>: and the knowledge<WH1847> of the holy<WH6918> is understanding<WH998>.
For by me thy days<WH3117> shall be multiplied<WH7235>, and the years<WH8141> of thy life<WH2416> shall be increased<WH3254>.
If thou be wise<WH2449>, thou shalt be wise<WH2449> for thyself: but if thou scornest<WH3887>, thou alone shalt bear<WH5375> it.
A foolish<WH3687> woman<WH802> is clamorous<WH1993>: she is simple<WH6615>, and<WH1077> knoweth<WH3045> nothing<WH4100>.
For she sitteth<WH3427> at the door<WH6607> of her house<WH1004>, on a seat<WH3678> in the high places<WH4791> of the city<WH7176>,
To call<WH7121> passengers<WH5674> <WH1870> who go right<WH3474> on their ways<WH734>:
Whoso is simple<WH6612>, let him turn in<WH5493> hither: and as for him that wanteth<WH2638> understanding<WH3820>, she saith<WH559> to him,
Stolen<WH1589> waters<WH4325> are sweet<WH4985>, and bread<WH3899> eaten in secret<WH5643> is pleasant<WH5276>. eaten: Heb. of secrecies
But he knoweth<WH3045> not that the dead<WH7496> are there; and that her guests<WH7121> are in the depths<WH6012> of hell<WH7585>.
